definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: Every family in our village has grain to spare.
The trouble is, the city is broke.
sentences.chinese: 問題是市政府也沒餘糧了。

sentences.english: In 1997, we started buying at protective prices all surplus grain farmers were willing to sell.
sentences.chinese: 1997年實行按保護價敞開收購農民餘糧等政策。

sentences.english: We grow just enough food for ourselves to eat, with no surplus grain.
sentences.chinese: 我們收的糧食剛夠自己喫，沒有餘糧。

sentences.english: He can continue to support himself and his family only if he produces a surplus .
sentences.chinese: 一個農民必須要有餘糧才能持續養活自己和家人。

sentences.english: If no surplus is available, a farmer cannot be self- sufficient .
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有餘糧可用，農民就不能自給自足。
